title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 166-1.6 - Annual rate formulas
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 166-1.6 - Annual rate formulas

State Regulations

The formulas which shall be used to calculate the tindustrywide annual rate of return on motor vehicle insurance written in New York for the period 1974-1983 follow: (a) RETURN ON NETWORTH
NY
= (INCOME
NY
/SURPLUS
NY
- (.5 x INCOME
NY
))
(b) INCOME
NY
=
(UNDERWRITING GAIN RATIO*
NY
x EARNED PREMIUM
CTY
)
+ INVESTMENT GAIN
CTY
- DIVIDENDS TO POLICYHOLDERS
CTY
- FEDERAL TAX
CTY
- ADJUSTED FEDERAL TAX
(c) ADJUSTED FEDERAL TAX =
(.46 x UNDERWRITNG GAIN RATIO*
NY
x EARNED PREMIUM
CTY
)
- (.46) x (UNDERWRITING GAIN
CTY
)
(d) SURPLUS
NY
= SURPLUS
CTY
+ (1 -.46) x (UNDERWRITING GAIN RATIO*
NY
x EARNED PREMIUM
CTY
)
- (.46) x (UNDERWRITING GAIN
CTY
)
(e) In the formulas above: (1)
NY = New York (from N.Y. Ins. Dept. Loss and Expense Ratios)
(2)
CTY = Countrywide All Lines (from Best's Aggregates and Averages)
(3).46 = Assumed Federal tax rate
* for Automobile (Motor Vehicle) Insurance only. (f) See section
166-2.6
of this Part for discussion of this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11
§§
166-1.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
